net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component

Class Label

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Label
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Component>, LocaleContextSource, Component, ListCellRenderer, TableCellRenderer, TreeCellRenderer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CountryInformationRenderer, CustomCellRenderer, DateFormatLabel, HTMLComponent, LocalizationRenderer, URILink

    @ConfigurableObject
@UIElement(supportsAction=false,
           name="text")
public class Label
extends ComponentImpl
implements TableCellRenderer, TreeCellRenderer, ListCellRenderer
    Displays static text. If you just need a cell renderer, use CustomCellRenderer instead of subclassing this component.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Label

        public Label()
        Create a new instance with a null text value. This constructor should be used to create a cell renderer that takes on the value of the cell.

      • Label

        public Label(@Nullable
     TextSource text)
        Create a new instance. If text is null then no text will be displayed. If used as a cell renderer the text displayed will be the String representation of the cell value.
        Parameters:
        text - The text, may be null.

      • Label

     TextSource text,

        Parameters:
        text - The text key, may be null.
        element - the text element.
        displayClass - the display class.

    • Method Detail

      • getCellTooltipAsText

        @Nullable
protected TextSource getCellTooltipAsText(@Nullable
                                       Object value)
        Get the cell tooltip as text.
        Parameters:
        value - the value.
        Returns:
        the text or null to disable a tooltip.

      • getCellValueAsText

        @Nonnull
protected TextSource getCellValueAsText(@Nullable
                                    Object value)
        Get the String representation of a cell value. Override this method to customize how a cell value is displayed. This method is called from all cell renderer methods. It is called from the validate() method so the component is attached.

        Support exists for the following value types.

        • NULL
        • *NamedObject
        • Date
        • Collection
        • Arrays

        Parameters:
        value - the cell value.
        Returns:
        text.

      • getEmptyCellValue

        protected TextSource getEmptyCellValue()
        Get the cell value to use when the value is empty. This implementation returns the empty string. It is called from the validate() method so the component is attached.
        Returns:
        String.

      • getHTMLElement

        public Element getHTMLElement()
        Get the top level elements this component will output in its current state. This should not included the entire content model.

        For example, if your code outputs the following, <p><span><b></b></span></p>, then you should only return one element that is a "p"; NOT "p, span, b".

        All configuration elements should be nested within this top element, or other arrangements should be made with the inner keeper.

        This returns a SPAN if no element has been specified. If you need to check to see if either setElement(TextElement) or withHTMLElement(Element) have been called you can use isHTMLElementSpecified().
        Specified by:
        getHTMLElement in interface Component
        Returns:
        the element.

      • getLabelFor

        public Component getLabelFor()
        Get the component for which this component is a label.
        Returns:
        Component or null.

      • getListCellRendererComponent

        public Component getListCellRendererComponent(ListModelComponent list,
                                     Object value,
                                     boolean isSelected,
                                     boolean hasFocus,
                                     int row)
        If the text value is null, take on the String representation of the value, otherwise keep the set value. Returns a Component to use for rendering a cell in a ListModelComponent.
        Specified by:
        getListCellRendererComponent in interface ListCellRenderer
        Parameters:
        list - The ListModelComponent that has the data being rendered.
        value - The value of the cell being rendered.
        isSelected - Indicates whether the cell is in a selected state.
        hasFocus - Indicates if the cell has focus, implementations may want to indicate this in the UI.
        row - The row for the cell.
        Returns:
        A Component which can be used to display the value stored in the specified list cell.

      • getTableCellRendererComponent

        public Component getTableCellRendererComponent(Table table,
                                      Object value,
                                      boolean isSelected,
                                      boolean hasFocus,
                                      int row,
                                      int column)
        If the text value is null, take on the String representation of the value, otherwise keep the set value. Returns a Component to use for rendering a cell in a table.
        Specified by:
        getTableCellRendererComponent in interface TableCellRenderer
        Parameters:
        table - The Table that has the data being rendered.
        value - The value of the cell being rendered.
        isSelected - Indicates whether the cell is in a selected state.
        hasFocus - Indicates if the cell has focus, implementations may want to indicate this in the UI.
        row - The row for the cell.
        column - The column model index (NOT the model index!).
        Returns:
        An object that is a Component which can be used to display the value stored in the specified table cell.

        public Component getTreeCellRendererComponent(Tree tree,
                                     TreePath path,
                                     Object value,
                                     boolean isSelected,

                                     boolean isLeaf,
                                     boolean hasFocus,
                                     int column)
        If the text value is null, take on the String representation of the value, otherwise keep the set value. Returns a Component to use for renderering a cell in a tree.
        Specified by:
        getTreeCellRendererComponent in interface TreeCellRenderer
        Parameters:
        tree - The tree component.
        path - The path to the node being rendered.
        value - The value of the cell.
        isSelected - Indicates whether the cell is in a selected state.
        isExpanded - Indicates if the path is expanded.
        isLeaf - Indicates if the path is a leaf node.
        hasFocus - Indicates if the cell has focus, implementations may want to indicate this in the UI.
        column - The column model index (NOT the model index!)
        Returns:
        Component.

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Called when a Component is first attached to a WindowManager. This means the Component should have valid return values from getApplication(), getLocaleContext(), getParent(). It is preferable to have all construction of the Component go here since a valid LocaleContext, Application object, etc., are available.

        When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class init(). init() is called only once for each Component. The parent component will have been init()ed before init() is called.

        NOTE: Do not call this method from application code. It is meant to be called by the WindowManager only.

        Specified by:
        init in interface Component
        Overrides:
        init in class ComponentImpl

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string indicating the text value, which may be truncated for length. This method cannot be used to display the text, use getText().
        Overrides:
        toString in class ComponentImpl

      • validate

        public void validate()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Normally called by the medium to make sure the component is in a valid state before updating the medium. Other classes may safely call as needed. Note however that validating may take a substantial amount of work depending on the subclass implementation!.

        NOTE: When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class validate() as the last statement in the overridden method.

        Specified by:
        validate in interface Component
        Overrides:
        validate in class ComponentImpl
